    • Method Detail

      • mouseClicked

        protected void mouseClicked(int row,
                            int col,
                            int clickCount,
                            int mouseButton)
        Given the information about a click on the board, it makes the proper action In Was, if you are a sheep, you need to select the piece first and the click into a valid cell to move it and if you are the wolf just click into any correct cell to move. If the click does not produce a valid action, it doesn't make anything.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in class BoardUI<WasState,WasAction>

      • nullSelected

        public void nullSelected()
        Set selected to null, in order not to paint selected when it's not the turn of that player In was we need to set selected to null
        Specified by:
        nullSelected in class BoardUI<WasState,WasAction>

      • paintSelected

        public void paintSelected(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Used to paint a circle around a selected cell on the board in certain games In was this method paints a square in the cells round the piece that is about to move to mark the valid options to move. Furthermore, it paints a circle around the selected piece if you are the sheep.
        Specified by:
        paintSelected in class BoardUI<WasState,WasAction>
